Thank you for letting us know! Please try uninstalling and reinstalling, and if the problem persists send your output log to owlchemysupport@google.com:

If you installed Job Simulator to the default location, that log will be located here:
If Steam:
C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Job Simulator\JobSimulator_Data\output_log.txt

If Oculus Home:
C:\Program Files\Oculus\Software\Software\owlchemy-labs-job-simulator\JobSimulator_Data\output_log.txt

one_reviews_text: One of the first few games I got when I got my oculus was this game and it's really fun and I like the soft vibe the game gives off and the ability to do whatever you like

Don't get me wrong, I really like this game. When first playing, the "storyline" or main quests are fun to play through and finish. Plus, each job option is different and fairly unique from the others! The one thing keeping this review of 5 stars is what to do after the main quests are complete. Sure, being able to complete more orders is nice, but then it gets old. It would be nice if the developers added some more things to do, such as a free roam area or possibly be able to own your own workspace / trophy room and get some items after you do certian things (ex. getting an egg after you cook eggshells in the chef career or something random like that) Otherwise, it's a great and comfortable game to play!

one_reviews_text:
This game sticks with it’s goal to be a “Job Simulation”.  Inside the game, you are first introduced with a  robot which teaches you how to get back to the hub etc.  Inside any of the jobs, you are introduced with a board which gives you instructions on what you can do.    Once a task is completed, the game automatically saves.  Back at the hub, you get to choose from which level you start at.

Pros: 
1. Everywhere you work is a smallish area, meaning that you could walk around (reduces dizziness) 

2. The game is very interactive and you can touch, and move almost everything at any given time

3. The game is not restrictive, and you could do anything you want, but the game itself will not gain levels.

 4. All of the game modes are mostly realistic, but still offering that hint of FUN! 

5. Game is great for kids!  Even offering a “I AM SMALL” lever underneath the area where you put game chartregies. 
 
6. Family Friendly + Party friendly.  This game is a great game for families and parties, as you could direct people on what to do from your TV, Computer, or even phone! 

7. Youtuber friendly.  In the game, you have an option to enable spectator mode, which gives you a controllable camera which you can put anywhere you want, and have it playing on your computer screen.   It may reduce frame rate, but for a youtuber, controlling the camera angle is a must have! (you could enable something from your desktop and control camera angles from there without having the virtual camera in your way) 

There is way more I could add, but I feel as if these are the mains

CONS

1. Depending on the audience you may get bored easily

2. Although you could through things at robots, the only thing they do is spark as little bit, and not have any major reaction

3. Instead of using the front tigger, you must use the SIDE!
As one can tell, there are a lot more pros than cons.  So if you do not mind the cons, then go right ahead and buy this game. I loved it, and I am sure almost everyo

I dont know if anyone else is having this problem,  but im on oculus rift and whenever i load up the game it always puts the middle of my setup too far in front so i have to move back, making my setup glitch very commonly. It has come to the point where its almost unplayable, please fix this. Besides that glitch, this is the perfect vr game to new people, and people familar with vr! I have no idea if you still update this game after vacation simulators release, but I guess you really dont have to because this game is already awesome!

I got my Oculus Rift S for myself, but I wanted to find games that my wife would like too. I tried this one, and scored big. She also has some issues with motion sickness with VR, but is perfectly fine with Job Simulator. It's a simple and fun game with a lot of humor to it, and it's pretty easy to get involved in. Definitely a great game for people just starting out with VR, or for people who are not big gamers to begin with.

I just don't get the appeal of this, apart from maybe as a demo for people who have never used VR.  Was bored quite quickly.  Game seems well-made though, so giving it an extra star for that.  Just not for me.
I like this! I have a suggestion though. Maybe the creators can add a "make your own job" or something.

review_title: A must have for all VR users!
one_reviews_text: This is truly one of the best VR experiences I have ever played! The main game isn't very long, I finished it in maybe 4 hours, but there's Infinite Overtime and mods to play with too! I love showing this to friends and family coming over. Highly recommend Job Simulator, five fat stars!

review_title: This was why I wanted VR
one_reviews_text: When I saw this being played on Youtube I wanted to play it so badly and it is what convinced me to get the Oculus. I love funny, silly simulators games and this one is full of charm and humour.

Unfortunately, not making the game a cross buy for oculus quest has ended the lifecycle of the game for me. I can not spend additional money to buy it for the detached oculus. Wires limited my gameplay on oculus rift. Without wires games have been more fun and I could set up in a larger room to play. But I can’t justify spending money for the same game twice with nothing new being added to it. Pretty sad but it is what it is. I won’t re purchase hames I own on the rift for the quest. They will just collect dust and lesson learned. Will steer clear of developers who don’t permit cross buy, and this includes future games that are not expected to be cross buy. Will spend money in game for devs that do offer cross buy.

review_feedback: Hi there, can you send an email to owlchemysupport@google.com about this so we can help you out? Thanks!

one_reviews_text: It’s so fun and funny one thing it is short but fun

It is bad business trying to make money off your customers by charging twice, this did not cost much or take much time. Also the sales will not make enough to make a difference but the sales on vacation sim can be hit by the same customers like me who will not buy it now based on you ripped off rift players on cross play. You also used to charge 40 dollars for this and on Psvr, which I also own it for Psvr. Due to Psvr having terrible tracking, I use rift and now also quest. Why try and charge twice to existing consumers who paid 40 dollars, espiecally the ones who went from Psvr to Rift or Vive.

After the sections, with mild wink humor, it is over and there is no reason to really play again. It is well produced so there is that. I guess my main issue is it's handholding and very scripted actions. Customer X comes in, you MUST do X,Y,Z to get them on their way. And that is that. Wish there was more to it. ----Wait a second, maybe this is simulating an actual job too well!
Please make a third Simulator Experiance! This is so addicting and fun!

one_reviews_text: hours of fun

In-cre-di-ble! Me, my 7 year old and my 4 year old love this game. It is fun, highly interactive, beautifully designed, and works on the abilities and limitations of Oculus Rift to perfection.

Job Simulator creators did an amazing job. Well done, definitely the best family VR game so far created. Oh, and just discovered it has a "short person" setting, making it easy for kids to play and reach all items in the game high up and on the floor. Awesome option!

My children 12 and 14 wanted me to get this game. It looked cartoonish and dumb but I purchased at thier request.  This game had me laughing within seconds.  We have about 20 titles in our library but this one gets a lot of play and is even fun to watch others play it. The jobs last about 30 min a piece but you can stay longer and mess around. You can't get fired no matter how bad you perform and the bots love you. There are 4 jobs.  I would give it 5 stars but I would like to see more interaction with objects. (more songs on the boom box, throw computer over cubicle , use coffee cup and water to put out fire etc.) You can interact with almost every object in this game but not everything.  If the developers could have done exactly what they have done with this game but more of it so that the creativity and interaction was 100% this game would be 5 stars.  This game is a lot of fun and very funny.
I thought this game was amazing but I just wish that they had more jobs. Other than that it was really fun.
this is the best game of the world
it funny
i bought it before for oculus rift , when i bout oculus quest,  they asked me to buy again 🙃

I am frustrated that I can’t reset my headset. You should’ve at least allowed us to change position. But we can’t do that. I would like to get closer to my sensors so I can at least turn on my animated computer but I can’t even do that. When you fix this problem I will delete my review.

I think for first time experiences, and also new to Vr its great with its interaction,smoothness and just overall great game! I like to point out that ive only played this a few times and rarely ever return to it, but thats just me. theres a overtime mode for each one to work 24/7 :)

review_title: Its a pretty good game... but...
one_reviews_text: I love the sense of humor this game has. Lately, I havn't been able to play because when I enter the game, I spawn far from the area im supposed to. Since this game does not support position resetting, I cannot play because I cannot reach the disks to put them in the slot to play. It's incredibly frustrating. I would really appriciate if you would allow resetting position. Or, if you were to recommend a solution. Thanks!

review_title: Great, especially for the younger crowd.
one_reviews_text:
Ever wonder what life will be like looking after the robot overlords have taken over the planet and human jobs are no longer necessary? Wonder no more! Step into the museum and Job Bot will be your guide as you experience daily life as a human in a number of various vocations.

You can interact with almost everything, with some surprising results!

It's so realistic you'll be waiting by the mailbox for your paycheck. (Ok, i might have exaggerated that last bit.)

I find the game silly and amusing, but my daughter absolutely loves this game. She will play it for hours looking for additional achievements or hidden Easter eggs.

It's well made and fun.

review_title: this game must be updated but...

review_title: this game is supper fun but short
one_reviews_text: I loved playing this game and it is very funny but the game is a little bit short. There is only 4 levels in the game that you play and each one is about 20 to 30 minutes long. you can play the levels again and once you play them all you can put in things like low gravity and there is and endless mode to each level but I just wish there were more levels. all in all it's a great and supper fun to play game and it runs great.

This game is so fun for people to enjoy i finnaly found everything and thats hard to do when you cant look at your achievments (you probally can im just dumb) my 4 year old brother didn't even get past the job museum and still loved the game! I wanted him to feel better and he managed to explore a whole lot

review_title: GREAT first time experience, not replay
one_reviews_text:
The game is FANTASTIC for running a VR experience for either your (or someone elses) first time. The tracking is excellent, it has 3rd person PC perspective for fun viewing, and it's pretty funny. An excellent introduction to VR games.

Everything is pretty linear, so expect very little replayability. For what it is though, its GREAT.
I really wish Infinite Overtime let you be more creative in some areas, like the gourmet chef. I don't wanna have to make toast every three minutes. Let me do my own thing, you know?

After you finish all levels, which I did in 1 day, theres really not much else to do, yes, I can play it again but its not fun like that for me. Only 4 levels is a bit short, looking forward to better things in Vacation Simulator.

review_title: One of the best games for VR.
one_reviews_text: Very silly humor. I have had many friends play it too. This definitely needs a dentist, surgeon and a doctor sim too.
You have nearly endless choices in what you want to do. Great game would reccomend to anyone!

one_reviews_text: This game has a lot of hidden eastereggs and the details are amazing. You can almost interact with any object as the game gives you whole freedom. I love the fact that the night mode adds more stuff and counts your tasks done. Really hope that updates will add even more!

hight was off by a little and could not recalabrat high

I have a cousin with Down Syndrome, so I put the headset on him and let him play this game. Not only was he able to understand what to do, this game gave him the ability to perform semi-realistic tasks that he is generally uncapable of doing outside of virtual reality. He once was playing that game for four hours straight. He was talking to the robots like he was actually there saying "Your Welcome!" after he would make them a fancy sandwich or fixed up their car, or what have you. I couldn't spend that much time in the game, but it is interesting and pretty funny what it lets you do. It just makes me so happy to see my cousing having so much fun in situations he would never be in otherwise.
Great intro to VR. not super dependant on having a lot of room, just a bunch of dumb fun stuff to mess around with!

My sister and I have fun taking turns playing the different jobs. Although there are not many hours of gameplay, it is one of those games that you can replay, or share with friends. Great game to get if you are new to vr. It has humor and the controls are flawless.

I was hoping for a comedy driven, fun game but instead i found the jokes a bit dull and the tasks a little mundane. I think this will appeal more to people that havent had work experience or to a younger player that may find the humour in the game.

review_title: I think I'm ready to get a job xD
one_reviews_text: This is one of the most fun games I have with the touch!  I really love doing all of the different jobs, especially in "Infinite Overtime" but my favorite job mode has got to be Gourmet Chef!  So much fun, I play it all the time!

This is one of the most simple and yet fun experiences on the Rift.

You are basically standing on a spot within a virtual toybox, role playing either a cook, mechanic, office worker or shop keeper.

There are some clever mechanics to make best use of the space you have available and some quests to introduce you to the different functionality. It's fun discovering the little things you can do.

It is great for kids too, and there is a mode select on the menu screen where you can reduce the height of the play area for the little ones. Enjoy!

review_title: Fun but the dial doesn't work.
one_reviews_text: So, for some reason, I don't know if this is just my game or not, the dial doesn't work for gourmet chef and store clerk. The dial is crucial for both of these jobs in many tasks to switch between different appliances, and when I try to use it my touch controllers just vibrate softly. Otherwise, the game is pretty enjoyable, a bit easy and the jokes aren't very funny, but I think over all it was a positive experience.
(it's only flaw is that it has too little content.... but that is somthing to look forward to!)

This is by far my favorite game I have ever played! Please create more jobs to play. :)

This game is probably the most innocent fun you'll have in VR. The game is very well developed and has a hilarious storyline. It's obvious the producers went through great lengths to make the story believable and the experience immersed. This is great for younger children. The game even has a "short human" mode that increases the rendering scale so that a smaller child can play.  Now if only we could get other developers to follow in the footsteps of this game, VR may actually compete with desktop and console games.

review_title: Great game with a few problems .
one_reviews_text: I really enjoy playing it and gives me something to do , It is a great game that views into jobs which is really fun but doesn't last long . The night shifts are great but my problem is that you basically repeat what your doing everytime . I wish there were a lot more jobs to enjoy playing , Many others have opinions but over all it is a great game and is worth the price .
I would absoloutly love it if you added more jobs ive played them all (including the add on's)
This game is amazing but I cannot figure out how to turn the switches for the different things to use. If anyone can help me that would be great!

Accounting (VR) is free and is better than this game.  Rick and Morty Virtual Rickality is better than this game.  The jokes aren't that funny and neither are the memes.  The only job that was interesting was the mechanic job.  The chef job was the worst, so boring and monotonous that I wanted to quit less than 5 minutes into that mini-game and sadly it never got better.  Counter Fight (Ramen Shop) is way better than this experience.  There's just no challenge to these jobs and they tend to be repetitive quickly.  There's some nice moments, but it's mixed in between several more dull moments.  I don't understand all the positive reviews.  I don't understand the price tag.  There are so many better VR experiences out there.  I'm out 20 bucks and regret getting this on sale.  Maybe kids would like this, but there's just nothing but menial tasks here.  The worst parts of Rick & Morty without any of the good stuff is what this game is.
My favorite game so  far on this! My kids LOVE it!

This is a great game no matter if you are completely new to VR, or if you have tried VR a thousand times before. However, the asking price is a bit high compared to the amount of playtime. But you do get 4 brilliantly crafted jobs, that are joyus to play.

*UPDATE*
The game has recieved a new update, allowing for endless missions in all jobs. This adds emense amounts of replayability, and even though it got slightly boring after a few hours, as the missions became repetetive, this update is great, and has allowed me to put a few more hours, into one of my favorite VR games. At this point I can definetly recommend this game. Now lets hope we get more jobs in the future.

the perfect game, had lots of fun with it!

Ok, I'm not sure if I'm doing something wrong.. But I've got a decently large tracking area, the largest I can get with in my room, with 3 cameras, at over 8ftx7ft.. Yet this Oculus version of the game seems to restrict me to the smallest play size possible in the game regardless. It just doesn't seem to account for all my extra space.
And as a result, while still remaining inside my guardian boarder, I can walk all the way outside of the play/work space, almost standing behind the robot-customers or job-bot. lol Kinda game breaking.
From what I've seen on yt, the SteamVR version seems to resize fine, and very dynamically.. So when I noticed I seem to have more space than some of those videos..
I feel like I'm missing out.. Tho maybe I'm just mistaken, and it needs EVEN MORE space before that takes effect. :/
So for now, 3 stars.. I'd give 5 overall, but this issue really bugs me.

This is a must have for seeing what VR can do, and showing others what Vr can do. The 4 jobs offer a perfect 45 minute or so "guided window" where you get tasks to do. It really is perfect for showing VR to your friends and family. It's fun to do yourself too! But only for those guided sessions. The game is funny as well. Just because it's old does not mean it's out of date!
this game is realy good but i want them to add more jobs
OMG BEST GAME I'VE EVER PLAYED (Besides the Climb)

review_title: A little pricey but a lot of fun!
one_reviews_text:
To mirror what others have said, this is more of an 'experience' than a game; you complete the given tasks whilst being a bit silly along the way. However, it is A LOT OF FUN.
The cartoon style graphics looks fantastic in VR and you do feel really immersed in your chosen role. There are plenty of laughs to be had and it's an excellent example of VR to show friends and family.
My only disappointment (and reason for 4 stars instead of 5) was the price Vs hours of gameplay. Realistically, once you've completed each of the 4 job roles, there's no reason to go back and so overall there's only an hour or two max game time per player and for the price paid (£18.99 at time of review) it doesn't feel like quite enough value for money. That being said, I'm hopeful that future updates will bring new job roles (so many potential jobs to simulate: Policeman, Doctor, Computer Technician, Builder).  I just hope that if this is the case, they add a few for free before charging for additional DLC. 
My advice: If don’t watch any YouTube clips of gameplay before you buy, as you’ll likely ruin all of the laughs for yourself. If you’ve got some cash to blow however, go for it. It’s a lot of fun!
not really for me but my son enjoys this very much and greatly the small mode. l wish there was a story mode.
I bought this game for my children and they love it ! they always play this game, it's a must have ! BUT... give us more content / jobs please !
Not a bad game, loved the overtime update. Adds to the replay value.

An excellent and funny introduction to the world of VR for new players.  The graphics are solid with the scripting and humour overall excellent.  Replay value? not sure, but it is wonderful while it lasts.

Such a good game with great potential, but feels incomplete with no freeplay mode with customers. Please have a freeplay mode where customers actually come with tasks so we can continue to play the jobs. Feels more like a demo than a full game. I'm kinda upset.

review_title: Fun for the whole family & friends
one_reviews_text: It could use more jobs, but the 4 it already has have plenty to discover and lots of laughs :)
Enjoyed it but very short. Feels more like a tech demo for $15 instead of $30.

If you own a VR headset, you've no doubt heard of Job Simulator. Once I got through it, I was somewhat disappointed at how it only lasted me slightly more then 2 hours, and started regretting my desision. However, after spending a lot more time with other titles, it has come apparant to me that I actually enjoyed this game the most, even more then the games which can last 10+ hours, even despite it's short playtime and lack of replay value. I love it's fun, cartoon-like art style and it's humour. I love how you can pick up any item you want and throw it, smash it, or eat it. I was truly amazed at how many things you can do (If you put your head on the photocopier, you can copy your brain! And if you see a robot wearing a hat or glasses, you can actually steal them and put them on!). This game has made me LOL more then any other VR title, and it is a must have for all VR owners! I do, however, strongly recommend having a good 360 setup though, as any occlusion will drive you mad.
If you're looking to buy a demo game to use when showing people VR for the first time, it's a contender.  The game itself is very short, and more tech demo than game.

Job Simulator is no more than an extensive VR demo. Which is fine as long as you know that going in. Its great to show new users, and funny as well.  Works really good with touch controllers, just make sure you have enough room all around as sometimes you have to reach behind you. Enjoy.

review_title: would not say it's worth the price
one_reviews_text: while yes its fun if you are a first time VR player, its lacking for others that have played other games similuar, kids will love it but does get repetitive for me. one time play then you are done, can't say I would play again.
I cannot turn the knobs in the store clerk or chef please help me.
How do I get it, when I descovered it I realised I did not have it and it would be nice to talk with a developer to trobleshoot this.

I think this was very well done. Perfect to show others. Roomscale would help sometimes as I did find myself turning around a few times and losing tracking. Something about the pointing and the controls seems off to me compared to other Touch titles...so Developers..fix that please so you aren't being non standard. Regardless, great title if a bit overpriced and I don't regret my purchase. This is not quite a demo, but it doesn't feel that deep. Finds a happy middle ground :-).

Edit: Got my 3rd sensor. Tracking is flawless for me at least with it and makes this game just a bit more enjoyable since I can turn in any direction :-)

Some have complained it's too short for the price, but it's still a great VR title. Good variety of jobs and funny interactions. I'm happy with the purchase. If you have fun with it, there's several hours of content here. Also, it's a good game to demonstrate VR capabilities.

review_title: Fun game with lots to do and see
one_reviews_text: This is a fun experience. You need to have a descent size space to play in. Some of the Job could easily continue endlessly with a different variety of customer, but they all end abruptly. It is not possible to play without the "Instruction board" or "Supervisor BOT"
Fun cute game first time through but not alot a replay value. Great game to have in your library for demos though.
Not a game where you should be looking to play a lot. But in the moment it is very funny and enjoyful.

Good concept, yet the game is lacking any real challenges.  Very short game, almost like them it's a tutorial they released.   Also, it lacked a scale mode so that my kids could play. Very dissappointed in the money I spent.  It might be worth 9.99 or so, not $30.

review_title: Bring friends over for this one
one_reviews_text: This game is basically a toy that is meant to be messed with. It is at its best when you are playing around with it, not just doing whatever it tells you. It's a fantastic (and very hilarious) demo for friends and family, it's got some great humor and clever jokes -- but playing it by yourself isn't really the same. The price is a bit high but that's VR for you at the moment.

review_title: Very fun game. It is short though.
one_reviews_text: Job Simulator is a fun game to play. It has four jobs. Auto Mechanic, Gourmet Chef, Office Worker, and Convenince Store Clerk. Each job is kinda long taking about an hour. This game is one of those games where you have to take it slow. If you rush through the game, it is short. But, if you play around, the game lasts longer. The game is a little overpriced, but it is VR.  Also, roomscale is highly recommended for this game. In conclusion, the game is short, but is is super fun to play.

This game is fun, it has great humour and you have plenty of silly fun stuff to do.

Amazing to demo, great to play. 

I get one star out of my rating because it is a bit short to my liking and replayability is not great. You will have fun during your playthrough tough, and that's what matters and justifiy the price tag to me.

Job Simulator is a glorified VR experience: it's expensive and over far too quickly (three hours at most of content).  That said, it's one of the best.  It's genuinely funny, full of charm and a technical wonderland of interactivity.  This is what all other VR experiences should strive for: a ridiculous, yet believable place to play around for a little while and I strongly recommend it.

review_title: Fun for first timers, short for the pric
one_reviews_text: It's a great showcase of what VR could do. The amount of attention to detail is what makes this game truly immersive as you can interact with pretty much every object in the environment. Only complaint is that it is a bit short for it's price. I bought it for $30 and finished it in about 3 hours. Although, that's just the premium for buying anything in VR currently I guess.

This is a very funny experience at first, but it does not have much depth and the novelty wears off quickly. Still enjoyable to check out though. As part of the launch bundle it was a good deal, it would be a little harder to recommend individually.

review_title: Expensive, but don't regret it at all!
one_reviews_text: At first, my kids pushed me to buy this. Is it a game, not really. More like very cool demo. But after some days, this is still the game my kids love the most and me too! Would I rebuy it again - absolutely!!
It's a fun first buy for any VR user.
So much fun playing this game. The humor is clever and well thought out and makes the game really fun. It is a great demo for anyone who isnt a gamer and wants something light.
Doesn't really hold up over time.  I wouldn't recommend it
Really fun! It has many things to mess up with.
Gets boring after an hour or so of gameplay. I would not recommend this to anyone.

I was so surprised to see that all quests who have never used the hand controllers immidiatly start playing Job Simulator. And you have to do a lot of different tasks. It is so easy to learn and fun to play.
Was good game but i dont understand why you dont loop customers lots of objects we dont even use, please update the game so freeplay still has customers with new orders.
